page.title: 13Trecarne Farm.
page.content: Trecarne Farm has 79 acres and the building is 250 years old. The farm has been owned by the family for 20 years. One of the fields is called the Clothes Line Field. Mr Lightfoot has 103 beef cattle, 3 milking cows, 83 sheep and 50 lambs. He grows potatoes, beet, corn and barley. All this is used on the farm except the potatoes. Some of the wooden gates are over 100 years old. There is a sea level mark carved into a stone wall. There is an old cottage over 200 years old with a fire place with the iron cooking pots in it. There is also a mounting block that people used to use to get on their horses.
